Jonathan Gossage wrote:

> 
> I test using Junit and JNI all the time. the trick is to specify the
> location of your JNI libraries/dlls in the java.library.path system property
> which you can set as a java command line argument
> as -Djava.library.path=c:\lib1\jnilib.dll;d:\lib2\jnilib2.dll   etc.
> 

As I understand it, this has the same effect as placing the DLL in a 
directory that's in the system PATH.  At any rate, it doesn't change my 
situation, but I appreciate the sanity check.

Thanks,

Mike
